page.title: 05ALINGTON ESTATE.
page.content: We went to see{Mr Smith}the farm manager and he told us alot about the estate and took us around{Top Farm.} For a long time they had just sheep and cattle but twenty years ago they stopped keeping sheep.The grazing land was then used for crops.The main crops which are grown on the estate are{Oil {Seed Rape,Barley}and{Wheat}but they also have a few acres of{Brussels {Sprouts}in the winter.The estate is divided by the Little Barford road.On the left handside of the road coming from{St. Neots}is where most of the crops are grown.On the right side the cattle are kept.
